children.value: class is a standard interface for interactions with the methods and events described in
. These interactions are generally concerned with actions within a colony, such as adding a new domain, creating a task, moving funds between pots, and managing permissions.
Generate a secret for task ratings. This function returns a keccak256 hash created from the input parameters.
The string that will be used to generate a secret.
The task rating that will be hidden (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A keccak256 hash that keeps the task rating hidden.
Get the address of the authority contract associated with the colony contract.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the authority contract associated with the colony contract.
Get the address of the Colony Network contract.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the Colony Network contract.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The ID of the local skill.
The ID of the funding pot.
Get the total number of domains in the colony. The return value is also the ID of the last domain created.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
Get the address of an extension contract associated with the colony address.
The name of the extension contract.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the extension contract.
Get information about a funding pot.
The ID of the funding pot.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The associated type of the funding pot (
The id of the associated type (
The total number of payouts that the funding pot cannot make.
Get the balance of a funding pot.
The ID of the funding pot.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The balance of tokens (or Ether) in the funding pot.
Get the total number of funding pots.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of funding pots.
Get the payout of a funding pot.
The ID of the funding pot.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The payout of tokens (or Ether) for the funding pot.

Get the total amount of funds that are not in the colony rewards pot. This is a value that keeps track of the total assets a colony has to work with, which may be split among several distinct pots associated with various domains and tasks.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total amount of funds that are not in the colony rewards pot.
Get the address of the owner of the colony contract.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the owner of the colony contract.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the assigned recipient.
A boolean indicating whether or not the payment has been finalized.
The ID of the funding pot.
Get the total number of payments.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
Get the total number of addresses that are assigned the colony
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of addresses that are assigned the colony
Get the inverse amount of the reward. If the fee is 1% (or 0.01), the inverse amount will be 100.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The inverse amount of the reward.
Get information about a reward payout cycle.
The ID of the reward payout cycle.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The reputation root hash at the time the reward payout was created.
The total reputation score throughout the colony.
The total amount of tokens at the time the reward payout was created.
The total amount of tokens allocated for the reward payout.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The timestamp at the time the reward payout was created.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The specification hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
The deliverable hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
The final date that the task deliverable can be submitted.
The ID of the funding pot.
The date when the task deliverable was submitted.
Get the total number of tasks in the colony. The return value is also the ID of the last task created.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:

Get the task payout amount assigned to a task role. Multiple tokens can be used for task payouts, therefore the token must be specified when calling this function. In order to get the task payout amount in Ether,
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The amount of tokens (or Ether) assigned to the task role as a payout.
Get information about a task role.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address that is assigned the task role.
A boolean indicating whether or not the assigned address failed to submit a rating.
The rating that the assigned address received (
Get the secret of a task work rating that has been submitted. If a task is in the commit period of the rating process, the work ratings are hidden in a keccak256 hash that was created from a
. The rating secret can be retrieved but in order to reveal the secret, one would have to know both the
The role that submitted the rating (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A keccak256 hash that keeps the task rating hidden.
Get information about the secrets of the task work ratings.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The date when the last secret was submitted.
Get the address of the token contract that is the native token assigned to the colony. The native token is the token used to calculate reputation scores, i.e.
token earned for completing a task with a satisfactory rating (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the token contract assigned as the native token for the colony.
Get the version number of the colony contract. The version number starts at
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The version number of the colony contract.
Check whether an address has a role assigned.
The address that will be checked for the role.
The ID of the domain that the role is assigned.
The role that will be checked (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A boolean indicating whether or not the address has the role assigned.
Check whether or not the colony is in recovery mode.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A boolean indicating whether or not the colony is in recovery mode.

The key of the element that the proof is for.
The value of the element that the proof is for.

A boolean indicating whether ot not the proof is valid.

Claim funds that the colony has received by adding them to the funding pot of the root domain. A set fee is deducted from the funds claimed and added to the colony rewards pot. No fee is deducted when tokens native to the colony are claimed.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The fee deducted from the claim and added to the colony rewards pot.
The remaining funds (after the fee) moved to the top-level domain pot.

which will eventually receive the following event data:

). This function can only be called by the address assigned the given task role after the task has been finalized.

Mark a task as complete. If the address assigned the task
role fails to submit the task deliverable by the due date, this function must be called by the address assigned the task
role. This allows the task work to be rated and the task to be finalized.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was completed.
Deprecate a global skill. This can only be called from the Meta Colony and only by the address assigned the colony
The ID of the skill that will be deprecated.
Enter colony recovery mode. This function can only be called by a user assigned the colony
Exit colony recovery mode. This function can be called by anyone if enough whitelist approvals are given.
Finalize a payment. Once a payment is finalized, no further changes to the payment can be made and the address that is assigned the payment can claim the payment.
Finalize a reward payout cycle. This function can only be called when the reward payout cycle has finished, i.e. 60 days have passed since the creation of the reward payout cycle.
The ID of the reward payout cycle.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the payout cycle that ended.
Finalize a task. Once a task is finalized, no further changes to the task can be made and each user assigned a task role can claim the payout assigned to their role.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was finalized.

which will eventually receive the following event data:

The address of the account that received tokens.
The amount of tokens that were transferred.

Submit the task deliverable. This function can only be called by the address assigned the task
role on or before the task due date. The submission cannot be overwritten, which means the deliverable cannot be changed once it has been submitted.

which will eventually receive the following event data:

Set the task specification. The task specification, or "task brief", is a description of the work that must be completed for the task. The description is hashed and stored with the task for future reference during the rating process or in the event of a dispute.
The specification hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
whose sender will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was modified.
The specification hash that was set (an IPFS hash).
